comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.8.0.6) Gecko/20060802 Firefox/1.5.0.6
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.8.0.6) Gecko/20060802 Firefox/1.5.0.6

Firefox crashes when I view a few trailers at the quicktime website, and then I tryed to view some flash movies at the youtube website.
I've compiled this version of firefox, but I've also experienced it with the binary version of firefox.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. view 2 to 3 movie trailers at quicktime.com
2. then try to view some flash movies on another website
3. then firefox crashes

Actual Results:  
/usr/lib/firefox-1.5.0.6/run-mozilla.sh: line 131:  6150 Segmentation fault      "$prog" ${1+"$@"}

Expected Results:  
firefox shouldn't crash
comments.creator: c0ld_darkness@yahoo.com
comments.raw_text:

comments.text:
Could you run your own copy in a debugger and get a stack trace for the
crash please?  That would help a lot.
comments.creator: mats@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:
Could you run your own copy in a debugger and get a stack trace for the
crash please?  That would help a lot.
comments.author: mats@mozilla.com

comments.creator: c0ld_darkness@yahoo.com
comments.raw_text:
0xb763a01c in __nanosleep_nocancel () from /lib/tls/libc.so.6

Is the result from the debugger.
comments.author: c0ld_darkness@yahoo.com
comments.text:
0xb763a01c in __nanosleep_nocancel () from /lib/tls/libc.so.6

Is the result from the debugger.

Did you do something like this? 

gdb firefox
handle SIG33 pass nostop noprint
run
<crash>
bt
comments.creator: ispiked@gmail.com
comments.author: ispiked@gmail.com

comments.creator: cbook@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:
-> closing as incomplete 

Jose, if you still see this crash with a recent release, it would be great if you could provide more information, see comment #1 and #3 from Mats and Adam.
